documents.document:
CHECK OUT OUR BAG OF CORNISH ALLSORTS AND PICK OUT YOUR FAVE

Hello from MyCornwall.tv! We've got a select pick of cornish allsorts to tickle your fancy over on our Best of Cornwall channel this week!

FAERY BALL
From over the seas and across the lands, a magical group of Cornish folk gather once a year near the shores of Penzance for a Faery Ball. MyCornwall.tv were there to experience the mystical entertainment which included a faery fashion show and live music from Celtic Rock band, the Dolmen! Check out the Cornish Faeries, goblins and more now!
http://www.myCornwall.tv?bcpid=27761084001&bclid=27610387001&bctid=62678121001

FIFTEEN MEETS FRUGI
Fifteen Cornwall recently launched an online store on their website. They collaborated with Frugi; an organic baby clothing company, to help design their clothing for their online store. Find out how these companies connected and just how important sustainability is to them on our Best of Cornwall channel.
http://www.myCornwall.tv?bcpid=27761084001&bclid=27610387001&bctid=62671648001

FIFTEEN FARMERS MARKET
We introduce you to the best producers in Cornwall at Fifteen’s Farmers Market. A Fifteen Apprentice takes us around the market and meets with the talented people that rear, grow, or catch the exceptional produce that Fifteen Cornwall use in their recipes! Click the link to watch!
http://www.myCornwall.tv?bcpid=27761084001&bclid=27610387001&bctid=62731324001

FEAST YOUR EYES ON THESE BEAUTIES...IT'S GASTRO WEEK!

Feeling hungry?!...We've got some scrumptious new content on our Gastronome Channel to tickle your tastebuds!.....

PATRON TO PATRON
Dave Waplington at Greenlawns Hotel
This month Fifteen Cornwall's Chief Executive, Dave Meneer heads over to the Garras Restaurant at Greenlawns Hotel in Falmouth. He chats to Chef, Dave Waplington who informs us about his future plans for the restaurant and his ideas to spruce up their menu.

COOKING WITH OUR FORAGER
Our very own Forager cooks us up a wild winter treat
See Miles cook up some pigeon over an open fire in the great Cornish outdoors...A perfect dish to accompany his foraged wild winter salad!

COCKTAIL OF THE MONTH
The perfect Valentines cocktail to tempt your lover
Fifteen Cornwall's Ricky makes a passion filled cocktail for all you couples out there. All you need is some champagne, brown sugar, rosewater, brandy and luuurve.

RECIPE OF THE MONTH
Not sure what to do with your leftover Roast Dinner?...
Look no further! Fifteen Cornwall's Head Chef, Neil Haydock creates an effortless yet delicious Hash simply by using the leftover Sunday Roast Dinner veggies.

PIRATES TV
Also this week, don't forget to check out Pirates TV as the Cornish Pirates take on Plymouth Albion at an away game this Saturday.
Kick off is at 2pm, and we go LIVE from 1pm to follow every try, tackle, kick and conversion! To access simply go to www.cornish-pirates.com

Don't forget to tune into our daily "WASSON?!" brought to you by Lena Martin. She will let you know what thrilling Cornish activities you can do around Cornwall everyday and also what new content is up on myCornwall.tv!

So, with 5 different channels to choose from, there are a wealth of things to watch, see and do at myCornwall.tv every day of the week so come on over.

And remember that we're always keen to hear from our viewers, so if there's something you think we should cover then please get in touch to info@mycornwall.tv

We're HOOKED on ADRENALINE this week !!!

"HELLO there" from the myCornwall.tv crew!
Need some adrenaline injected into your lives this week?....Well, we've got some awesome new content on our Adrenaline Junkie Channel to get you all energised!

Cornwall is bursting with amazing Pro-surfers, and we're lucky enough to have snapped up an exclusive chat with Pro-Surfer, Reubin Pearce about his surfing endeavours in Cornwall and around the world. Gain an insight into the wonderful world of this talented surfer

Check out our cool teaser on Cornish Pro-Skater, Sam Bosworth! Sam recently won gold at the 2009 X Games in Amateur Halfpipe and he's made history by being the first ever UK Skater to win at the X games at only 15 years old! He shows off his incredible moves to myCornwalltv

So, you saw him surfing the Cribber before Christmas and now you can get to know the real Ben Skinner in our exclusive profile! Ben Skinner, aka "Skindog" has been surfing since the tender age of 3 and he's now hunting for a World title achievement! Witness his passion for the sport on our ADRENALINE JUNKIE CHANNEL!

http://www.mycornwall.tv

If you LOVE Cornwall, you'll LOVE this....

Greetings from the myCornwall.tv crew!

We've got plenty of 'ansum content to keep you entertained this week on our myKernow Channel.....

STORIES IN STONE- EPISODE 7:
This month in Stories in Stone, Episode 7, Emlyn ventures to the Lizard Peninsula (the most southerly point in Britain) to find out how a unique type of rock found only on the Lizard became fashionable and is becoming increasingly rare. Click this link to see the investigation:
http://www.myCornwall.tv?bcpid=27761084001&bclid=27583542001&bctid=68312434001

CORNISH HURLING:
Hurling is an outdoor team sport of Celtic origin played only in Cornwall for well over 400 years! It used to take place all over Cornwall but now it's confined to St Ives and St Columb. Click the link below to catch a climpse of the silver ball being hurled through the crowds to see how each town's representation of the game:
http://www.myCornwall.tv?bcpid=27761084001&bclid=27583542001&bctid=68553998001

HERE IS MY HOME
In recent times many of Cornwall's traditional industries have been in decline. Making a living from farming has never been more difficult than it is at present. In this short film, directed by Barbera Santi we get a fascinating insight into what it's like to grow up on an isolated farm in West Cornwall. Click this link to watch:
http://www.myCornwall.tv?bcpid=27761084001&bclid=27583542001&bctid=68549587001

BENEATH A MACKEREL SKY
Not much is known about the Cornish Victorian photographer Edward Bragg but the images he's captured have left a legacy! Emlyn Harris went to visit Phil Nichols from Helston who has been researching the life of this great photographer. Click this link to see what he finds:
http://www.myCornwall.tv?bcpid=27761084001&bclid=27583542001&bctid=68329438001

Have a fantastic week peeps and remember to tune in everyday to find out what's on in Cornwall...on our daily "WASSON?!"

Cheers

myCornwall.tv

If you LOVE Eden, you'll LCVE this....

HELLOOO from myCornwall.tv! Hope you all had a fantastic time celebrating St.Pirans in this Cornish sunshine.

Here's the latest on our EDEN PROJECT TV CHANNEL.....

-WHAT'S ON AT EDEN THIS MONTH See "What's on Eden Project TV" this March by Anna Meneer.

-WHAT'S EATING TIM SMIT? Tim Smit discusses the debate over whether climate change is happening or not. Also, Tim tells us why he loves Eden so much! Do you share the same reasons as Tim?

-THE FUTURE OF CORNWALL What's in store for our Duchy? Anna Meneer talks to Kevin Lavery, Chief Executive of Cornwall Council about his vision for Cornwall's future

-TEA WITH A GARDENER Go backstage at Eden for a cuppa Eden's Gardeners invite you to have "Tea with a gardener" until 1st April. Green fingered enthusiasts will be able to go backstage at the Eden Project for a cup of tea and some advice on a whole range of gardening subjects.

-BRIGHT YOUNG THINGS Celebrating young Cornish talent. Bright Young Things was a celebration of young talent in the South West held at Eden. It showcased the skills of young people in the famous biomes. Check out the best entries in the music, art, creative writing, performance and building design categories.

-CLAY COUNTRY ECO TOWN Chairman of St Austell Eco-town shares his thoughts. See an insightful interview with Tim Smit and Samih Sawaris about the development of St Austell clay country Eco-town. With 5 channels on myCornwall.tv we've got a whole load of awesome programmes to keep you entertained!

Go to http://www.mycornwall.tv to check them out! All the best

myCornwall.tv crew

HELP HALL FOR CORNWALL KNIT A REALLLY LONG SCARF!

From spinning wheels to knitting needles! Hall for Cornwall is aiming to encourage everyone to get knitting this year - and maybe set a world record in the process!
Want to get involved? start by getting in touch! Email them at info@reallylongscarf.org.uk for information on how you can contribute. They're particularly keen to find volunteer Knitting Ambassadors to help spread the word and assemble the segments into a single length of scarf!

The final scarf will be donated to other UK good causes (poss Salvation Army, shelter etc). The target is over 34 miles if Cornwall is to beat Wales!

Or click this link to find out more....

http://www.hallforcornwall.co.uk/index.cfm?articleid=49084

TANTALISE YOUR TASTEBUDS with our NEW GASTRO CHANNEL CONTENT

Alreet me lovers? Hope you're enjoying this Cornish sunshine as much as us! We've got loads of yummy Cornish goodies on our Gastronome Channel this week.....

-CORNISH CHALLENGE 2010- Over the years the Cornish Challenge has become the focal point of culinary expertise for our region. Since it began 16 years ago, standards of cookery from professional chefs have increased immensely and as a consequence this event has become the pinnacle of local gastronomic potential! See which team were crowned the ultimate Gastro Winners!

-RECIPE OF THE MONTH- See Fifteen Cornwall's Head Chef, Neil Haydock rustle up some delicious Banoffee Pancakes....Perfect as a 'Breakfast in bed' treat for Mothers Day!

-PATRON TO PATRON- Watch Chief Executive of Fifteen Cornwall, Dave Meneer visit Truro's award winning Bistro, Bustophers. Dave has a chat with General Manager, Tom Hancock whilst their Head Chef, Rob cooks up his delectable signature dish for us!

-COCKTAIL OF THE MONTH- Ricky from Fifteen Cornwall treats us to another of his splendid cocktails this month...What better way to spend your weekend (or weekday evening) sipping a different cocktail every month?!

Don't forget to tune into our daily WASSON?!brought to you by Lena Martin. She's out and about beautiful Cornwall everyday to let you know what exciting activities you can get up to around Cornwall and also what new programmes to check out on myCornwall.tv. So, with 5 different channels to choose from, there are a wealth of things to watch, see and do at myCornwall.tv every day of the week so come on over!

And remember that we're always keen to hear from our viewers, so if there's something you think we should cover then please get in touch to info@mycornwall.tv All the very best from myCornwall.tv

FEEL OUR ADRENALINE RUSH!!!

HELLO THERE from the myCornwall.tv crew! Whether you're into Extreme sports on land or sea, we've got something for you! Take a look at our Adrenaline Junkie Channel this week.... http://www.mycornwall.tv

-LEGENDS OF THE BOWL- If any of you skateboarders have skated "The Bowl" in Playing Place, near Truro you'll know it's one of the trickiest skate spots around! See if some Cornish skaters can handle it!

-NUMBER 03- Every time there's a decent swell, you'll find Cornish surfer, Sam Smart in the sea! Watch Sam and his friends enjoying a spur of the moment surf at a secret spot in Cornwall.

-TRIALS MOUNTAINBIKING- Trials mountainbiking is an extreme test of bicycle handling skills over all kinds of obstacles; both natural and man-made. We introduce local talent, Rich Pearson as he shows us a few of his tricks and tells us why he has chosen to pursue this sport in Cornwall.

REMEMBER TO WATCH OUR DAILY WASSON?!WHERE I TELL YOU WHAT'S ON IN CORNWALL AND WHATS ON MYCORNWALL.TV! AND FOR ALL YOU PIRATE FANS OUT THERE...JOIN US LIVE AND ONLINE ON PIRATES TV, AS THE BOYS TAKE ON BRISTOL TOMORROW @ 7:45PM KO! Go to www.cornish-pirates.com to access your Pirates TV pass!

Have a fantastic week me 'ansums!

GET SPOOKY IN KERNOW THIS SPRING!

Q: What do witches, ghosts, and St Piran have in common? A: The exciting new content on MyKernow Channel this week!

-"STORIES IN STONE: Episode 8" The Boscastle Flood- This month Emlyn Glanmor Harris visits Boscastle to find out how this world famous tourist attraction managed to survive the floods that devastated the village in 2004. see how this fishing port has coped since then!

-"HAUNTED CORNWALL"- Just how haunted is The Jamaica Inn? We launch the first of our monthly features, "Haunted Cornwall" where we were joined by Most Haunted's Historian, Richard Felix at an overnight paranormal investigation at The Jamaica Inn in Bolventor, Launceston! see what spooky things we encountered in this haunted pub now!

-"BENEATH A MACKEREL SKY" Episode 8- Curach tradition. Emlyn meets sculptor, boat builder and designer, Rory Macphee. Rory teaches Emlyn the ancient art of building boats from animal skins. see what happened.

-"ST PIRANS DAY": How did we celebrate it this year? Each year people travel from all over the world to celebrate St Piran's Day in Cornwall.
Held on the 5th March, we celebrated the Duchy's national day in style at Perranporth and Bodmin. Discover how an obscure Irish monk became the Patron Saint of Cornwall in this colourful spectacle!

http://www.mycornwall.tv
Have a great weekend!

SPRING HAS SPRUNG AT THE EDEN PROJECT!

Spring has finally sprung... especially at The Eden Project! See what springtime delights are happening at our Eden Project TV Channel this week.... http://www.mycornwall.tv

-WASSON AT EDEN?- Anna Meneer tells us what's going on behind the scenes at The Eden Project this month!

-WHATS EATING TIM SMIT?- This month, Tim Smit joins Chief Executive of Fifteen Cornwall, Dave Meneer on the stunning Isles of Scilly to discuss some of the green challenges the Islands face.

-21st CENTURY LIVING PROJECT- See how a hundred households across England try to reduce their carbon footprint over a year! Can your household do any better?

-DAISY ROOTS- Cornwall's first eco-florist! See our delightful film on Cornwall's unique green eco florist specialising in Cornish grown, fairtrade and organic flowers! -

Don't forget to tune into our daily WASSON?! brought to you by me, Lena Martin. I'm out and about stunning Cornwall everyday to let you know what exciting activities you can get up to around Cornwall and also what new programmes to check out on myCornwall.tv.
So, with 5 different channels to choose from....

BEST OF CORNWALL- Showing the best highlights from all our channels here, including Cornish events

ADRENALINE JUNKIE CHANNEL- Showcasing Surfer profiles, extreme sports and events around Cornwall

MYKERNOW- Emlyn Glanmor Harris explores our cornish history and culture

GASTRONOME- Perfect for all you foodie fans! As well as covering foodie events, we show cocktails of the month made by our cocktail connoisseur, Ricky from Fifteen Cornwall. Also, Fifteen Cornwall's Head Chef, Neil Haydock cooks us up a monthly recipe and we visit a cornish Restaurant every month in 'Patron to Patron'

EDEN PROJECT TV- What goes on behind the scenes at the infamous Eden Project? We show it all here! ....There are a wealth of things to watch, see and do at myCornwall.tv every day of the week so come on over! And remember that we're always keen to hear from our viewers, so if there's something you think we should cover then please get in touch to info@mycornwall.tv

All the very best from myCornwall.tv

FOOD GLORIOUS (cornish) FOOD on our GASTRO CHANNEL NOW! mmmm

HELLO THERE from the myCornwall.tv crew! On this beautiful sunny day we'd like to introduce you to the foodie delights of Cornwall over on our GASTRONOME CHANNEL this week...Mmmm!

http://www.mycornwall.tv

-RECIPE OF THE MONTH- Seafood Bucatini;
Surrounded by the sea, Cornwall is of course noted for its fresh seafood! Fifteen Cornwall's Head Chef, Neil Haydock whip up some homemade seafood bucatini. And did you know that the flour used to make this yummy pasta was grown near Padstow?

-COCKTAIL OF THE MONTH- Apple and Vanilla Mojito;
Ah, go on...Treat yourself to our delectable Cocktail of the Month created by Ricky from Fifteen Cornwall! Don't drink too many though...hiccup!

-PATRON TO PATRON- Saffron Restaurant in Truro;
This month Dave Meneer heads to the city to chat with Head Chef, Nik Tinney about his eclectic menu style and passion! See why Saffron is one of Truro's most popular restaurants now!

-FORK TO FORK- Cornish Blue Cheese Company;
We find out how Philip Stansfield makes this award-winning blue cheese step-by-step at his tranquil farm in Liskeard. Watch it to make your mouth water!

Don't forget to tune into our daily WASSON?!brought to you by me, Lena Martin. I'm out and about the beautiful land of Kernow everyday to let you know what exciting activities you can get up to around Cornwall and also what new programmes to check out on myCornwall.tv.

So, with 5 different channels to choose from....

BEST OF CORNWALL- Showing the best highlights from all our channels here, including Cornish events

ADRENALINE JUNKIE- Showcasing Surfer profiles, extreme sports and events around Cornwall

MYKERNOW- Emlyn Glanmor Harris explores our cornish history and culture

GASTRONOME- Perfect for all you foodie fans! As well as covering foodie events, we show cocktails of the month made by our cocktail connoisseur, Ricky from Fifteen Cornwall. Also, Fifteen Cornwall's Head Chef, Neil Haydock cooks us up a monthly recipe and we visit a cornish Restaurant every month in 'Patron to Patron'

EDEN PROJECT TV- What goes on behind the scenes at the infamous Eden Project? We show it all here!

....There are a wealth of things to watch, see and do at myCornwall.tv every day of the week so come on over!

And remember that we're always keen to hear from our viewers, so if there's something you think we should cover then please get in touch to info@mycornwall.tv

All the very best from myCornwall.tv

ALSO, STAY TUNED....THERE ARE GOING TO BE SOME EXCITING CHANGES TO MYCORNWALL.TV VERY SOON. Watch this space!!!

GET OUT THERE IN THE CORNISH SUN!!!

Alreet me 'ansums? myCornwall.tv have been loving this weather we've had this week...So much so, we've got a load of exciting extreme sports on our ADRENALINE JUNKIE CHANNEL to get you outside!

-RICH PEARSON- PART 2- Mountainbiking in Cornwall;
Part 2 of our fantastic Trial Mountainbiking feature with Cornish Pro, Rich Pearson! See what tricks he pulls off for us in Truro.

-A GUIDE TO...SURFING -How hard can it be?
Now the weather's heating up, its the perfect time to learn how to surf and Cornwall is just the place to do it! We join Pete Atherton from Xtreme Academy at sunny Watergate Bay to find out how.

-SKATE PROMO- The Cornish skate scene;
Check out our awesome promo where we give you a taster of our new monthly Skating feature!

Don't forget to tune into our daily WASSON?!brought to you by me, Lena Martin. I'm out and about the 'ansum land of Kernow everyday to let you know what exciting activities you can get up to around Cornwall and also what new programmes to check out on myCornwall.tv.

So, with 5 different channels to choose from....

BEST OF CORNWALL- Showing the best highlights from all our channels here, including Cornish events

ADRENALINE JUNKIE- Showcasing Surfer profiles, extreme sports and events around Cornwall

MYKERNOW- Emlyn Glanmor Harris explores our cornish history and culture

GASTRONOME- Perfect for all you foodie fans! As well as covering foodie events, we show cocktails of the month made by our cocktail connoisseur, Ricky from Fifteen Cornwall.ÂÂ Also, Fifteen Cornwall's Head Chef, Neil Haydock cooks us up a monthly recipe and we visit a cornish Restaurant every month in 'Patron to Patron'

EDEN PROJECT TV- What goes on behind the scenes at the infamous Eden Project? We show it all here!

....There are a wealth of things to watch, see and do at myCornwall.tv every day of the week so come on over!

And remember that we're always keen to hear from our viewers, so if there's something you think we should cover then please get in touch to info@mycornwall.tv

All the very best from myCornwall.tv

WE FEEL LIKE DANCING!..new content on MYKERNOW CHANNEL now!!

This month we're not sure whether its all this glorious weather or if its from watching our new content on our MYKERNOW CHANNEL that got us dancing...you'll have to decide for yourselves!

BENEATH A MACKEREL SKY - Modern Jive Cornwall:
Emlyn Glanmor Harris goes to the most westerly town in the UK; 'Penzance' to see how Rosalie Ginn's love of dance led her to start one of the most popular jive dance clubs in the area, "Modern Jive Cornwall" Click this link to get dancing....
http://www.myCornwall.tv?bcpid=27761084001&bclid=27583542001&bctid=79496629001

THE FIRST DANCE- Origins of Helston Furry Dance:
Every year people from all over the world come to see the Helston Furry Dance. The dance takes place at the beginning of May and its one of the oldest traditions in Britain! Click the link below to see Emlyn investigate the origins of the dance and what it means to residents of Helston in the 21st Century....
http://www.myCornwall.tv?bcpid=27761084001&bclid=27583542001&bctid=79488686001

CORNISH MYSTERIES- Is Bude Castle haunted?:
We continue our ghostly theme from last month as we venture to Bude Castle to take part in a paranormal investigation with Cornish ghosthunters 'The Soul Survivors.' What will we find? Click the link to see.....
http://www.myCornwall.tv?bcpid=27761084001&bclid=27583542001&bctid=79517200001

WILD ABOUT KERNOW - Grey seals in Cornwall:
Welcome to our new series "Wild about Kernow" we visit Gary Zammit at a secret seal habitat in Cornwall. Click the link to see and hear how we can help to make less of an impact on these habitats.....
http://www.myCornwall.tv?bcpid=27761084001&bclid=27583542001&bctid=79496617001

Don't forget to tune into our daily WASSON?! brought to you by me, Lena Martin. I'm out and about the picturesque land of Kernow everyday to let you know what exciting activities you can get up to around Cornwall and also what new programmes to check out on myCornwall.tv.

So, with 5 different channels to choose from....

BEST OF CORNWALL- Showing the best highlights from all our channels here, including Cornish events

ADRENALINE JUNKIE- Showcasing Surfer profiles, extreme sports and events around Cornwall

MYKERNOW- Emlyn Glanmor Harris explores our cornish history and culture

GASTRONOME- Perfect for all you foodie fans! As well as covering foodie events, we show cocktails of the month made by our cocktail connoisseur, Ricky from Fifteen Cornwall.

Also, Fifteen Cornwall's Head Chef, Neil Haydock cooks us up a monthly recipe and we visit a cornish Restaurant every month in 'Patron to Patron'

EDEN PROJECT TV- What goes on behind the scenes at the infamous Eden Project? We show it all here!

....There are a wealth of things to watch, see and do at myCornwall.tv every day of the week so come on over!

And remember that we're always keen to hear from our viewers, so if there's something you think we should cover then please get in touch to info@mycornwall.tv

All the very best from myCornwall.tv

WE HAVE A BRAND NEW SITE!!!!

A BIIIG HELLO from the myCornwall.tv crew! Well, we've finally launched our brand new and improved version of myCornwall.tv so check it out! We've got a few creases to iron out over next few days but we'd love to know what you think.

Also, this week we show you whats happening behind the scenes at the infamous Eden Project on EDEN PROJECT TV! So have a look below and see what tickles your fancy....

-WASSON AT EDEN THIS MONTH- Join Anna Meneer at the Lost Gardens of Heligan to see 'Wasson' at The Eden Project this month.

-2010 EDEN SESSIONS- Who's performing this year?
The Eden Sessions are a series of one-day live music festivals in the spectacular setting of the Eden Project! Anna Meneer talks to Eden Sessions promoter, John Empson about the 2010 Sessions line up!

-HELIGANS 20th ANNIVERSARY- Tim Smit explores The Lost Gardens of Heligan. Heligan is the world-renowned restored productive gardens and pleasure grounds! Join Tim Smit's walk around Heligan to commemorate their 20th anniversary.

-THE ECOTOWN EXHIBITION- How do you feel about it? The Clay Country Ecotown exhibition opens to the public. For those of you unfamiliar with the Eco-town project its a very exciting and ambitious opportunity to regenerate the Mid-Cornwall Clay area. See how the locals feel about this development!

-THE BIG LUNCH 2010- Get involved this year!
You may remember The Big Lunch last year where we encouraged people to have lunch with their neighbours; in streets, park, gardens and even car parks! It's a day to get together and put a smile back on Britain's face! See Tim Smit's introduction to The Big Lunch 2010. With more organisations joining this year, its set to be bigger and better!

-WHATS EATING TIM SMIT? Never underestimate the power of nature! With the recent issue of the Icelandic volcano eruption, Britain stood to a standstill!...See Tim Smit's reflection on this.

-SCILLY OUTTAKES- Tim Smit & Dave Meneer's outtakes!
See some of the funny outtakes from Tim Smit and Dave Meneer's recent trip to the Scillies!

Don't forget to tune into our daily WASSON?! brought to you by me, Lena Martin. I'm out and about the lovely land of Kernow everyday to let you know what exciting activities you can get up to around Cornwall and also what new programmes to check out on myCornwall.tv.

So, with 5 different channels to choose from.... (and more on the way!)

BEST OF CORNWALL- Showing the best highlights from all our channels here, including Cornish events

ADRENALINE JUNKIE- Showcasing Surfer profiles, extreme sports and events around Cornwall

MYKERNOW- Emlyn Glanmor Harris explores our cornish history and culture

GASTRONOME- Perfect for all you foodie fans! As well as covering foodie events, we show cocktails of the month made by our cocktail connoisseur, Ricky from Fifteen Cornwall. Also, Fifteen Cornwall's Head Chef, Neil Haydock cooks us up a monthly recipe and we visit a cornish Restaurant every month in 'Patron to Patron'

EDEN PROJECT TV- What goes on behind the scenes at the infamous Eden Project? We show it all here!

....There are a wealth of things to watch, see and do at myCornwall.tv every day of the week so come on over!

And remember that we're always keen to hear from our viewers, so if there's something you think we should cover then please get in touch to info@mycornwall.tv

We've got a BRAND NEW MUSIC CHANNEL!..."K-Music"

HELLOOO from the myCornwall.tv crew! We're SO excited about the launch of our sparkly new music channel, 'K-MUSIC!'

K-Music will bring to you a variety of music from the BEST Musicians/Artists/DJ's from around the Duchy! Get the inside scoop from featured artists, whether local and on tour. With coverage of events, gigs, festivals, and talking face to face with some of our music industry professionals, we hope to make K-Music a music hub for all tastes!

See the many musical delights we have for you this month....

-THE UNDERBELLY; What are these funksters up to?-
We catch up with Cornwall's funksters 'The Underbelly' Find out about their new album '7 feet under' and see footage of them live on BBC-6 Music on Craig Charles Funk & Soul Show!

-SUE ASTON; Classical Cornish Violinist-
We have an encounter with Sue Aston, a classical Violinist from Cornwall whos celtic music is inspired by her surrounding landscape. She has worked with Nigel Kennedy and Chris De Burgh, which is just the tip of the iceberg! Find out about the Classical music scene in Cornwall and what she's got planned for 2010!

-KERNOW IN THE CITY;St Pirans Day in London-
The St Pirans Day celebration, organized by Lenny George (Capital Radio) and Louis Eliot (Louis Eliot and the Embers) was held at the ICA in London and featured Cornish musicians, 'Auction for the Promise Club' filmaker Alexander Turvey and other class acts. K-Music went on tour to bring YOU the vibe from the city!

-APE; Newly signed Cornish band-
Newly signed to Black 7 Record, (Groovefinder Productions) original Rock band from the land of Kernow give us inside info on the band, and what can be a challenge and a blessing about trying to make the big time when you're based in the countryside! Keep your eyes peeled for what happens next in Part 2.

-JOSIE AND THE LOVECATS; Awesome music video-
Making a big noise on the music front at the moment for Cornwall, the delicate and encapsulating voice of Josie and her very talented 'Lovecats' are playing Glastonbury, The Castle and many big other venues around the UK. See their new music video 'Brother' and an interview coming up very soon!

-MISS WORLD; Spine chilling stuff-
K-Music brings you the very talented and almost underground Miss World, with the creative and brilliant mind of J.Perkins at the helm. 'The Night Porter' will chill you to the bone and make you think twice about your next stay in this spooky Hotel! Sounding a bit Ian Dury and a little bit Tom Waits we urge you to check this out. We are loving it!

-XAVIER RUDD; His cornish experiences-
We caught Xavier Rudd touring enroute and this handsome and talented Aussie was more than happy to share his tour stories with us!

-BEN HOWARD;Winner of Red Stripe Music Awards 2009-
We catch up with Ben at a SW1 gig, supporting Xavier Rudd. After winning the Red Stripe Music Awards, this bright young musician from Devon tells us how he quit University to become a professional musician and where this decision has taken him since!

-THE SEA; Wicked music video-
These boys from Newquay have been banging the drums of success around the world! Supporting Muse in 2009 at their Seaside Rendevous and now having been on a European tour over the last few months, K-Music has the pleasure of showing their music video, 'Sun Noir'. Reminiscent of The Doors and sounding like White Stripes but more Rock n Roll we hope you enjoy! Interview is coming soon.

-HAYSEED DIXIE; A hilarious interview-
These Appalachian Rockgrass Hellraisers stop off on their tour to tell us about their new album 'Killer Grass' as well as sharing some funny tales. See what the nicest hairiest bikers you're ever likely to meet say to K-Music!

HOPE YOU ENJOY OUR SELECTION!
All the best,

myCornwall.tv

Check out our SPRINGTIME DELIGHTS for you to SAVOUR! yum

HELLO THERE from the myCornwall.tv crew!

When we think of Cornish food, 'pasties' and 'cream teas' spring to mind...While these icons of traditional culture are still cherished, our food and drink industry is exploding with award-winning and imaginative Cornish producers! We had the pleasure of meeting some of these Cornish producers at Porthleven Food and Music Festival, as well as foraging along our Cornish shores for some seaweed and sampling scrummy cocktails at Fifteen Cornwall....Phew, we have been busy! Scroll down the page, see which feature takes your fancy and bon appetit!

-PORTHLEVEN FOOD AND MUSIC FESTIVAL- We went to this exciting Food and Music Festival set around the beautiful harbour of Porthleven in April. With Antony Worrall Thompson as the patron, over 40 local artisan food and drink producers attending, inspiring cooking demos AND live music being performed over the course of the weekend; it was a great success! See our exclusive interviews with Antony Worrall Thompson and other high-profile chefs, as well as soaking up this fantastic festival atmosphere!
http://www.mycornwall.tv?bcpid=64381026001&bclid=27613408001&bctid=85383607001

-THE FORAGER: PART 3- We go foraging once again with Miles Lavers along the picturesque Gunwalloe Beach! He cooks up some cornish seaweed on the beach! See how it turns out now!
http://www.mycornwall.tv?bcpid=64381026001&bclid=27613408001&bctid=85381477001

-COCKTAIL OF THE MONTH: SUNDOWNER- Ricky from Fifteen Cornwall puts a spring in our step with his latest cocktail, "Sundowner" See how he makes this springtime delight now. Cheers!
http://www.mycornwall.tv?bcpid=64381026001&bclid=27613408001&bctid=85629682001

Don't forget to tune into our daily WASSON?! brought to you by me, Lena Martin. I'm out and about the lovely land of Kernow everyday to let you know what exciting activities you can get up to around Cornwall and also what new programmes to check out on myCornwall.tv.

So, with 6 different channels to choose from.... (and more on the way!)

BEST OF CORNWALL- Showing the best highlights from all our channels here, including Cornish events

ADRENALINE JUNKIE- Showcasing Surfer profiles, extreme sports and events around Cornwall

MYKERNOW- Emlyn Glanmor Harris explores our fascinating cornish history and culture

GASTRONOME- Perfect for all you foodie fans! As well as covering foodie events, we show cocktails of the month made by our cocktail connoisseur, Ricky from Fifteen Cornwall. Also, Fifteen Cornwall's Head Chef, Neil Haydock cooks us up a monthly recipe and we visit a cornish Restaurant every month in 'Patron to Patron'

EDEN PROJECT TV- What goes on behind the scenes at the infamous Eden Project? We show it all here!

K-MUSIC- Bringing you a variety of music from the best Musicians/Artists/DJ's from around the Duchy. Get the inside scoop from the featured artists, whether local and on tour. With coverage of events, gigs and festivals, and talking face to face with some of our music industry professionals, we hope to make K-Music a music hub for all tastes, and a showcase of Cornwalls diverse musical talent, past, present!

....There are a wealth of things to watch, see and do at myCornwall.tv every day of the week so come on over! And remember that we're always keen to hear from our viewers, so if there's something you think we should cover then please get in touch to info@mycornwall.tv

All the very best from myCornwall.tv

WE'RE COVERING THE UK PRO SURF TOUR LIVE AND ONLINE! yeaaah

Hey everyone! Thought you may wana know that myCornwall.tv are filming THE UK PRO SURF TOUR LIVE online on our new channel, SALTBOX!!! We're filming at Saltburn this weekend so tune in to http://www.mycornwall.tv at 2pm tomorrow to get the latest action! woo hoo

Other dates and venues TBC!

CORNISH PIRATES WIN THE BRITISH AND IRISH CUP FINAL!!!

Hey everyone,

AWESOME NEWS! The Cornish Pirates won the British and Irish Cup Final yesterday and myCornwall.tv were there to cheer the boys on! Highlights of this fantastic match will be up online later this week on PIRATES TV!

Beautiful weather = ADRENALINE time!

HUGE HELLO from the myCornwall.tv crew! The weather certainly is heating up (finally!) so we rushed outside into the warm Cornish air to bring you an awesome selection of ADRENALINE content to get you inspired....

Scroll down the page, see which feature takes your fancy and feel the ADRENALINE RUSH!.......

-JULIE KITCHENS FIGHT HIGHLIGHTS:
Julie Kitchen v Claire Haigh...Who wins?

-MEET THE SMITH TWINS (PRO SKATERS FROM TRURO)
Only a handful of UK skaters to have made the ranks of European Pro Team member! He flirted first with surfing following a family move to Cornwall aged 12, but soon switched board sports where he has since blazed a trail for aspiring UK skaters. myCornwall.tv get an exclusive with Jody and his twin brother, who is also Pro-skater. See them showing off their siiick moves !

-UK PRO SURF INTERVIEWS:
With Reubin Pearce & Martin Black all the way from Saltburn Beach!

SEE THE UK PRO SURF CONTEST LIVE AND ONLINE THIS WEEKEND!!

MASSIVE weekend planned in myCornwall.tv world! The next leg of the UK Pro Surf Tour hits Croyde in North Devon and our new channel, Saltbox.tv will be there to show it all live and for FREE!!

Just go to our website www.mycornwall.tv on Saturday and Sunday, click on our SALTBOX CHANNEL and see the surf contest LIVE! woo hoo

Its SUMMERTIME on our EDEN PROJECT TV CHANNEL!!

Dydh da from the myCornwall.tv crew! Howlyek yw hi (it's Sunny) so The Eden Project is in its glory at the moment...their awe inspiring gardens, cutting edge iconic architecture and vibrant rainforest really makes this a top visitor attraction!

This week we give you an exclusive insight into the wonderful world of Eden and we head over to the stunning Isles of Scilly to see 'Wasson?!' there!.....

WASSON AT EDEN- Anna keeps you informed about what's happening at Eden Project in June.

WHATS EATING TIM SMIT?-See what Tim Smit thinks about our new hung parliament.

TURF CUTTING CEREMONY- Find out what happened when EPTV (Eden Project TV) went over to St Marys for the official turf cutting ceremony for the new school thats being built for the islands. See Anna Meneers interview with Headmaster, Bryce Wilby.

LINDA RUTENBERG- Meet Night-time photographer, Linda Rutenberg. During the months of April and May she was Eden's Artist in Residence where she photographed the gardens and Biomes by night, and by day she prepared her images for her fantastic exhibition 'Eden at Night' which is currently showing at Eden.

BUGLE GREENPEACE- Bugle Greenspace is an enthusiastic group of local residents, volunteering to make a difference in their community. Their group came together to encourage Bugle residents to form and express opinions on the development of local community spaces proposed as part of the Government Eco Towns initiative; and they've never looked back! Find out how this group of clay country residents are shaping the ecotown plans!

COFFEE IN THE BIOMES- We venture into the stunning Rainforest Biome where we meet Hettie. As well as the thousands of unique plantations and flowers there she picks us some coffee, yes thats right, coffee!

CHAT WITH A SCILLONIAN PILOT- See our fascinating interview with Scillonian Captain, Pete Crawford on board!

Don't forget to tune into our daily WASSON?!brought to you by me, Lena Martin. I'm out and about the lovely land of Kernow everyday to let you know what exciting activities you can get up to around Cornwall and also what new programmes to check out on myCornwall.tv.

The Sea, Stone, Surf & Sawmills!

Myttin da from the myCornwall.tv crew
We've got some MUSICAL TREATS to set you up for the weekend; We hang out with Musician/Surfer Ben Howard, catch up with The Sea, get the inside scoop from music producer and engineer, Dare Mason and chill out with Angus and Julia Stone.....

MEET BEN HOWARD- Multi-talented musician and surfer-
Talented Singer/Songwriter from Devon, Ben Howard has been making waves all over Europe; in the sea and the music scene! If that sounds like an awesome lifestyle, watch now.

IN SESSION WITH THE SEA- We catch up with these Newquay brothers -
K-Music went down the river to Sawmills Studio to catch up with the Cornish brothers from The Sea. Alex and Pete have just got back from their European Tour and we hung out with them to find out whats in store for their second album.

FACE THE MUSIC WITH DARE MASON- Music producer and engineer -
For our first 'Face the music' interview we hung out at the V.I.P lounge with Music Producer and engineer, Dare Mason. Renowned for working with international acts like Placebo to nurturing our homegrown talent here in Cornwall; he recently produced Sue Aston's latest album and has worked with Ethatone.

ON ROUTE WITH ANGUS & JULIA STONE-
Chill out with their mellow sounds; The latest Tour-stop is from Brother and sister Duo, Angus and Julia Stone. With their soft, chilled-out vibe these Aussies tell us about their musical upbringing and play us an exclusive acoustic number in the garden.

ENJOY!

myCornwall.tv

Watch the Gul Night Surf LIVE and for FREE from NOW all weekend!

http://www.saltbox.tv

Attention FOOD LOVERS; its GASTRO WEEK!

Dydh da from the myCornwall.tv crew

We've got some CORNISH FOODIE DELIGHTS to whet your appetites; In the morning we went to Nathan Outlaw's Seafood and Grill in Rock for our latest Patron to Patron, then we nipped down the road for lunch to sample some oysters at Porthilly Oyster Farm for Fork to Fork and then Neil Haydock from Fifteen Cornwall rustled up his last dish..... for a perfect dinner recipe.....

PATRON TO PATRON
Meet our very own Cornish Celebrity, Nathan Outlaw

Overlooking the Camel estuary, the Seafood and Grill in Rock is the perfect place for a relaxing meal or simply a drink and snack throughout the afternoon on their fabulous terrace. Between his hectic TV schedule on Saturday Kitchen and Great British Menu, Dave Meneer manages to have a chat with their talented Head Chef, Nathan Outlaw about his achievements and of course, his signature dish! Click HERE to meet Nathan.

FORK TO FORK
Porthilly Oyster Farm in Rock

We had the delight of spending a sunny day on the shoreline with Tim Marshall, owner of Porthilly Oyster Farm in Rock, learning about his amazing oyster process! We even sampled our very first oysters, yum! Porthilly Farm will also play host to the inaugral Rock Oyster Festival ever on the north coast of Cornwall this weekend so remember to head down there. But before you do that, click HERE to watch our fascinating feature.

RECIPE OF THE MONTH
Neil Haydock's last recipe
You may or may not have heard that Neil Haydock has left Fifteen Cornwall as Head Chef. He's been replaced by Adam Banks who will continue to make us tasty easy-to-follow recipes every month. Click HERE to see Neil's very last recipe for us; (name of recipe) and farewell Neil, you will be missed!
